intro: Cyrtandra haelaauensis, commonly known as the Hanaula Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Cyrtandra haelaauensis is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
